events.description: The Indian Rebellion of 1857, also known as the Sepoy Mutiny, was a major uprising against British East India Company rule.
events.impact: Led to the end of East India Company rule and direct British Crown control

events.description: The Indian National Congress was founded in Bombay by A.O. Hume, marking the beginning of organized political movement.
events.impact: Became the primary vehicle for India's independence movement

events.description: Lord Curzon partitioned Bengal, sparking widespread protests and the Swadeshi movement.
events.impact: United Indians against British rule and sparked nationalist sentiment

events.description: British troops under General Dyer fired on unarmed civilians in Amritsar, killing hundreds.
events.impact: Turned public opinion against British rule and radicalized the freedom movement

events.description: Gandhi launched the Non-Cooperation Movement, urging Indians to boycott British institutions.
events.impact: First mass movement involving millions of Indians

events.description: Gandhi led a 240-mile march to make salt, defying British salt monopoly.
events.impact: Gained worldwide attention and demonstrated power of civil disobedience

events.description: Gandhi's call for immediate British withdrawal with the slogan 'Do or Die'.
events.impact: Final major push that made British rule untenable

events.description: India gained independence from British rule on August 15, 1947.
events.impact: End of 200 years of British colonial rule
